steplist.step: Step 1. Heat the stock to a simmer in a medium saucepan, then lower the heat so the stock stays hot.

steplist.summary: Step 2. Heating oil and adding chopped ingredients
steplist.step: Step 2. In a large saucepan, heat the oil and 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium heat. When the butter has melted, add the chopped shallot or onion. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes.

steplist.summary: Step 3. Adding rice and wine to the pot
steplist.step: Step 3. Add the rice to the pot and stir it with a wooden spoon. Sauté for one minute and add the wine until it's fully absorbed.

steplist.summary: Step 4. Adding chicken stock to the rice and stir
steplist.step: Step 4. Add a ladle of hot chicken stock to the rice and stir until the liquid is fully absorbed. When the rice is almost dry, add another ladle of stock and repeat the process.

steplist.summary: Step 5. Ading chicken stock at time intervals
steplist.step: Step 5. Continue adding stock, a ladle at a time, for 20 to 30 minutes.

steplist.summary: Step 6. Add hot water if chicken stock runs out
steplist.step: Step 6. If you run out of stock and the risotto still isn't done, you can finish the cooking using hot water, adding a ladle at a time.
Step 7. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons butter, the Parmesan cheese, and the parsley, and season with with Kosher salt.

ingredients.ingredient-name: 1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed

steplist.step: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
Step 2. Place beef in a small baking dish, and spread 2 tablespoons softened butter. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from pan, and let it cool completely.
Step 3. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and mushrooms for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool.
Step 4. Mix pate and 2 tablespoons softened butter, salt, pepper. Spread pate over beef with onion and mushroom mixture.

steplist.summary: Step 5. Placing beef in pastry dough
steplist.step: Step 5. Roll out pastry dough and put beef in the center. Fold up and seal all edges. Place beef in a 9 by 13 inch baking dish, and brush with egg yolk.

steplist.summary: Step 6. Baking the beef and dough
steplist.step: Step 6. Bake at 450 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 minutes, then heat to 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 to 15 minutes. Set it aside then keep warm.
Step 7. Stir in beef stock, red wine, and the leftover beef juices over high heat in a small saucepan. Boil for 10 to 15 minutes and serve with the beef.

ingredients.ingredient-name: 1 cup carrot, cut into 1 inch slices
1 cup celery, cut into 1 inch slices
3 medium potatoes, cut into 1 inch chunks

steplist.summary: Step 1. Heating oil in a saucepan
steplist.step: Step 1. Heat oil in a large, saucepan over medium heat.
Step 2. Add onions, garlic, carrots, celery, and mushrooms.
Step 3. Cook 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 4. Add small amounts of water, if necessary, to prevent sticking.
Step 5. Add remaining ingredients, except flour, 1/4 cup water, and wine.
Step 6. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 30 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Step 7. Stir occasionally while cooking.

steplist.summary: Step 8. Stirring flour and water in a bowl
steplist.step: Step 8. In a small bowl, gradually stir flour into 1/4 cup water until smooth.

steplist.summary: Step 9. Adding mix and wine to stew
steplist.step: Step 9. Add to stew, along with wine.
Step 10. Cook, stirring for 5 more minutes.

steplist.summary: Step 11. Remove bay leaf and serve
steplist.step: Step 11. Remove and discard bay leaf before serving.

ingredients.ingredient-name: 1 3/4 cups HONEY MAID Graham Cracker Crumbs
3 (8 ounce) packages PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
1 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream

steplist.step: Step 1. Heat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
Step 2. Mix graham crumbs, butter and 1/4 cup sugar; press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.

steplist.summary: Step 3. Making the cream cheese mixture
steplist.step: Step 3. Beat cream cheese and remaining sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended. Add sour cream and vanilla.
Step 4. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating on low speed after each addition just until blended. Pour over crust.

steplist.summary: Step 5. Baking and refrigerating the cheesecake
steplist.step: Step 5. Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minute or until center is almost set. Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim. Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hours.

steplist.summary: Step 6. Adding pie filling to the top
steplist.step: Step 6. Top with pie filling before serving.

steplist.summary: Step 1. Mixing ingredients in a small bowl
steplist.step: Step 1. In a small bowl, combine cracker crumbs, sugar and butter.

steplist.summary: Step 2. Dividing mixture into 8 dessert dishes
steplist.step: Step 2. Divide among 8 dessert dishes, about 4 teaspoonfuls each.

steplist.summary: Step 3. Making the cream cheese mixture
steplist.step: Step 3. In a small bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually, add milk until blended.

steplist.summary: Step 4. Adding in lemon juice and vanilla
steplist.step: Step 4. Beat in lemon juice and vanilla and spoon 1/4 cup into each dish.
Step 5. Top wih pie filling, about 1/4 cup in each.

steplist.summary: Step 1. Mixing ingredients in a large dish
steplist.step: Step 1. In a large dish mix together the granulated sugar and the cinnamon. Set to the side.
Step 2. In a large skillet heat the canola oil until bubbly and hot.
Step 3. Place one tortilla in the skillet cook for 10 seconds then using tongs flip over, and  begin to fold in half.
Step 4. Continue to hold one side of the tortilla with tongs. Then flip to ensure the other side cooks evenly. Remove from the skillet
Step 5. Dip both sides in the cinnamon sugar and sprinkle cinnamon sugar in the inside of the taco shell.
Step 6. Once the taco shells are cooked, chop 1 cup fresh strawberries and rinse half cup raspberries. Place them off to the side.

steplist.summary: Step 7. Mixing cream and powdered sugar in stand mixer
steplist.step: Step 7. Add heavy cream and powdered sugar to a stand mixer with a whisk attachment and whip for about 1 minute.

steplist.summary: Step 8. Placing mixture in a piping bag
steplist.step: Step 8. Place in a piping bag or a ziplock baggy and cut a corner tip off to pipe.

steplist.summary: Step 9. Adding nutella into a ziplock baggy
steplist.step: Step 9. Add Nutella into a ziplock baggy and cut one side of the corner with scissors.
Step 10. Pipe the nutella evenly and add in fruit. Lastly, add whipped cream on top.
Step 1. Toast the bread slices.
Step 2. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on each slice.

steplist.summary: Step 3. Adding the meat and vegetables
steplist.step: Step 3. Layer bottom slice with letuce, tomato, turkey, bacon, cheese

steplist.summary: Step 4. Adding second slice of bread on top
steplist.step: Step 4. Put the second slice of bread on top.

steplist.summary: Step 5. Microwave to melt the cheese
steplist.step: Step 5. Heat in microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until cheese is melted.

steplist.summary: Step 1. Melting butter and sautee vegetables
steplist.step: Step 1. On medium heat melt the butter and sautee the onion and bell peppers.
Step 2. Add the hamburger meat and cook until meat is well done.
Step 3. Add the tomato sauce, salt, pepper and garlic powder.
Step 4. Cook the noodles as directed on the label.

steplist.summary: Step 5. Mixing the sauce and noddles
steplist.step: Step 5. Mix the sauce and noodles.

ingredients.ingredient-name: 1 cup Old El Paso Thick 'n Chunky Salsa

steplist.summary: Step 1. Melting butter and sautee vegetables
steplist.step: Step 1. Cook beef in 10-inch skillet over medium heat 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until brown.
Step 2. Stir salsa into beef. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly; reduce heat to medium-low.
Step 3. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour beef mixture into large serving bowl.
Step 4. Heat taco shells as directed on package. Serve taco shells with beef mixture, lettuce, tomato and cheese.
